repository.corpname: Columbia University.Rare Book and Manuscript Library,

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: Correspondence, manuscripts of poems, and manuscripts of lectures by Benjamin. The correspondence consists of original letters of Benjamin, typescript and photostatic copies of Benjamin letters in other libraries, and letters to Benjamin from some of his literary contemporaries including Paul Hamilton Hayne, Willis Gaylord Clark, John Lothrop Motley, and Fitz-Greene Halleck. Many of the letters relate to Park Benjamin's lecture tours. There are other family letters and many documents relating to the Benjamin family,and two letterbooks of John Lothrop Motley. Also, a large amount of genealogical material of the Benjamin family, and its related families from the 16th century to the present day. There are also financial records, monographs, clippings, and photographs.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: Selected materials cataloged; remainder arranged. Box 1-4: Cataloged correspondence; Box 5-6: Cataloged manuscripts & documents; Box 7-8: Poems; Box 9: Lectures; Box 10-11: Genealogical materials; Box 12: Demerara accounts; Box 13: Photographs & sheet music; Box 13-15: Printed materials; Box 16: Benjamin family items; Box 17-22: Merle Hoover notes.

accessrestrict.head: Access Restrictions
accessrestrict.p: The following boxes are located off-site: 7-22. You will need to request this material from the Rare Book and Manuscript Library at least twenty-four (24) hours in advance to use the collection in the Rare Book and Manuscript Library reading room. This collection is located on-site.

acqinfo.head: Acquisition
acqinfo.p: 01/26/1994 M-94-01-26 Letterbook of J.L. Motley 5285B (NYState) Purchase
05/20/1994 M-94-05-20 A. Lincoln letter Pratt, Dallas Bequest

custodhist.p: Gift of William E. Benjamin, 1937; added to by gifts from his family.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Identification of specific item; Date (if known); Benjamin Park papers; Box and Folder; Rare Book and Manuscript Library, Columbia University Library.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: Letterbook of J.L. Motley Cataloged 04/04/1994 HR

userestrict.head: Restrictions on Use
userestrict.p: Single photocopies may be made for research purposes. The RBML maintains ownership of the physical material only. Copyright remains with the creator and his/her heirs. The responsibility to secure copyright permission rests with the patron.

otherfindaid.p: Finding aid available in repository and online.
